1604065415_mirrored_Shufflow80_github.body:
I have the same problem. I published a site on my laptop which I was then able to connect to via my Android phone via Chrome. I've updated the site but now the Android Chrome states 'no peers found'. I am unable to open port 15441 in Android as, to do this, I was advised to:
Tap "Settings | Wireless & Networks | Wi-Fi." Touch the "Menu" button and then press "Advanced." Write down the information to the right of the IP Address field. My phone reports 'IP address unavailable'. 

I then installed Orfox: Tor on the Android but it reports 'Unable to connect' when I try to access the site via Tor (so I got further with Chrome).

My laptop reports that port 11460 is closed but 'your tor gateway is running well'. I opened port 11460 previously but it made no difference to the 'port closed' label.

I have also enabled 'Tor: Always' on the laptop, but this also makes no difference to the Android connection.

Is there anything else I can do to enable my Android to find a peer (my laptop) and update the site?
Should this issue be re-opened?

For reference: With Orbot now running the browser finds 3 peers, but reports 'index.html download failed'. Content updates were successfully updated and published from the laptop. I deleted the site on the mobile then re-visited it. It downloads all the files again and again reports 'index.html download failed'.
I just then tried 'check files' on the mobile (Android) and finally it updated all files and now appears to be working.
Thanks for your info. In future I should ensure:
- Update and publish the site via the web interface
- Ensure my client (Android in this case) is using a tor client.
I guess this can remain closed now ...

1604066545_mirrored_dotnetspec_github.body: Thanks for the response. The email is very slow to update despite internet running well. It's been stuck on '298 left' for the past 2 hours for eg. I tried opening port 11460 in Win 7 (probably unnecessarily) but I still get port closed message top right (I'm not experienced with ports). My 'router' is my Android phone (hotspot) and I don't think it has the option to open ports. I tried stopping and re-starting ZeroNet but still 298 left. Anything I can do to get past the blockage?

Still stuck on 298 and same error when I attempt to create mailbox. Is there a way to clear the 298 invalid files? Also, since, on startup
Checking public keys in database...........................[ 48%]
is reported it's perhaps not surprising there are issues. It's been stuck on 48% for the past 2 hours today. I have similar issues most days I start up although I have reached 100% on occasion (still can't create mailbox even then though).

I did that (had to manually delete the folder in "ZeroNet-win-dist\ZeroNet-win-dist\data" directory first)  and I get the 'successful registration' email although there are still 7 files left.
I deleted ZeroMail on Android, re-updated and that's working as well now. Thanks again for your help.
I was told that the bot doesn't work - won't send a reply to inbox so had to manually test instead.

1604066548_mirrored_dotnetspec_github.body: Thanks for the info. I'm the site owner. I was accessing the site through my mobile phone. I still get the problem when I'm online via my laptop (where the site was created).

The file that needs updating is content.json and the 'Need Updating' message appears even when it's been recreated (via delete and update). The peer (mobile) won't download the content.json which, I presume, is related to the fact that the original site states that the content.json needs updating (so nothing works until I can resolve this).

1604066559_mirrored_dotnetspec_github.body:
Thanks (I own the site) but, as mentioned in step 2, I have signed the site (numerous times). 

I visited the site through my mobile with Orbot running. My mobile found 1 peer (my laptop) and displayed 'content.json download failed' which I suspect is related to the 'NEEDS TO BE UPDATED: content.json' message in the site web app controller interface.

I originally installed and ran ZeroNet, and the site, from a thumb drive. Since I was having these problems I tried installing it to my hard drive instead. However, I continue to have the same problem there.

This problem prevents me from using ZeroNet and recommending it to others (which I'm keen to do).

Here's the link:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1C1hKsqjQTR1iy1ijB3qtrqBwfH2Hf7TMW/

Screenshots:

![screen shot 06-05-18 at 09 59 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27340988/40950992-ba360452-68a7-11e8-9f83-326ce12cbc32.PNG)
![screen shot 06-05-18 at 10 00 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27340988/40950993-ba8038ce-68a7-11e8-9fda-ea88abdc9699.PNG)
![screen shot 06-05-18 at 10 01 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27340988/40950994-bab1f2a6-68a7-11e8-92ce-18b1da408782.PNG)

Console output is either 'file updating' or 'no peers' under Squash Passion Apps.

Hope this helps ...

Here's a mobile screenshot:
![screenshot_2018-06-05-10-06-29-896_com android chrome](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27340988/40951149-5cc5930e-68a8-11e8-9042-c7bf5871c1c1.png)

Please note I get the same message if a peer (my laptop) is found.

I'm focused on getting it to work on mobile (it has on this device previously) because the users will be primarily mobile based.

Here's the file folder on the mobile device:

![screenshot_2018-06-05-10-20-43-240_com mi android globalfileexplorer](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27340988/40951603-552e7636-68aa-11e8-93e4-e9e6e75b0177.png)

Thanks. That did it ...

ZeroNet appeared to have trouble recognizing my laptop as a peer. My laptop is using the mobile as a hotspot. Perhaps sharing the network in this way, with Tor as well, created a problem? It appears that as soon as a more 'standard' situation was applied (your device becoming a peer) it resolved itself quite effectively.

Thanks again to everyone helping on this ...

topic.title: Create My Mailbox: File write error: [object Object]
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

  * ZeroNet version: _____0.6.2 rev 3467
  * Operating system: _____Win 7
  * Web browser: _____Chrome
  * Tor status: available
  * Opened port: no
  * Special configuration: ____No

### Step 2: Describe the problem:
Select ZeroMail:
Selected username: shoeswasabi789@zeroid.bit......[NO MAILBOX FOUND]
Click 'Create My Mailbox' 
Error msg appears to right: 'File write error: [object Object]'


#### Steps to reproduce:

  1. _____At http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/
Select ZeroMail
  2. _____ Click 'Create My Mailbox' 

#### Observed Results:

Error msg appears to right: 'File write error: [object Object]'

![screen shot 05-23-18 at 03 39 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27340988/40410174-ac73ce24-5e9f-11e8-8cf7-142ff3085de1.PNG)

#### Expected Results:

 A message informing me a new mailbox for shoeswasabi789@zeroid.bit has been created

topic.title: Website: 1 file update failed: index.html

* Web browser: _____Chrome
* Tor status: available
* Opened port: no
* Special configuration: ____No

Phone will update all files except index.html

#### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Delete website: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GgfFjoBVGvCqf4ePXfcvWVBJrGR9Zzayw/
  2. Visit website
  3. Peers found: 2
  4. Download site

#### Observed Results:

#### Expected Results:

  * Website to display index.html file with js and image file references working

topic.title: NEEDS TO BE UPDATED: content.json - how?
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

* ZeroNet version: _____0.6.2 rev 3467
* Operating system: _____Win 7
* Web browser: _____Chrome
* Tor status: available
* Opened port: no
* Special configuration: ____No

### Step 2: Describe the problem:
Website info panel informs me (probably correctly) that the content. json needs to be updated - how do I do that?

#### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Create site (files copied from a previous site that was experiencing problems)
  2. Sign and publish
  3. Open website data panel (top right)
  4. Site control - update - get 'site updated' message

Also tried deleting content.json ->update site (a new json file is generated) - > no change (after stopped and re-started ZeroNet)

#### Observed Results:
No change. Info panel still states:
NEEDS TO BE UPDATED: 
content.json

#### Expected Results:
 content.json will be updated when site is updated and/or signed
